message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the characteristics of different types of cells. Option (A) is correct because bacterial cells, like all living cells, must perform all life functions such as metabolism, reproduction, and response to stimuli. Option (B) is incorrect because a lung cell is a specialized cell that performs specific functions related to respiration. Option (C) is incorrect because a flower cell is also a specialized cell that performs specific functions related to reproduction and plant growth. Option (D) is incorrect because there is no such thing as a "tail cell."

This question requires knowledge of basic biology and the characteristics of different types of cells. Option (A) is correct because bacterial cells are unicellular organisms that must perform all of the necessary life functions. Options (B), (C), and (D) are incorrect because they specify specific types of cells (lung cell, flower cell, tail cell) which are specialized cells and do not perform all life functions like a bacterial cell does.

This question requires knowledge about the different types of cells and their functions. Option (A) is correct because bacterial cells are single-celled organisms that are capable of performing all life functions independently. Option (B) is incorrect because lung cells are specialized cells that are part of a larger organism and cannot perform all life functions on their own. Option (C) is also incorrect because flower cells are specialized cells that make up the different parts of a flower and cannot perform all life functions on their own. Option (D) is incorrect because there is no such thing as a "tail cell" and it does not relate to any known cell type or function.

This question is asking about the cell type that must perform all life functions. Option (A) is correct because a bacterial cell is a single-celled organism that must perform all life functions on its own. Options (B), (C), and (D) are incorrect because they refer to specific types of cells found in multicellular organisms that have specialized functions.

Option (D) is incorrect because a "tail cell" is not a recognized term in cell biology and does not perform all life functions.

Option (A) is correct because bacterial cells are unicellular organisms that must perform all life functions on their own, including metabolism, reproduction, and response to stimuli.
